Kassiopeia  3
Monte Carlo simulation program specializing in tracking particles in electric and magnetic fields

9  KSTrajInterpolatorHermite::KSTrajInterpolatorHermite()

13  KSComponent()

23 
24  void KSTrajInterpolatorHermite::Interpolate(double aTime,
25  const KSTrajExactIntegrator& anIntegrator,
26  const KSTrajExactDifferentiator& aDifferentiator,
27  const KSTrajExactParticle& anInitialParticle,
28  const KSTrajExactParticle& aFinalParticle,
29  const double& aTimeStep,
30  KSTrajExactParticle& anIntermediateParticle ) const
31  {
32  //cubic interpolation on all variables, except postion, which is quintic
33 
34  //exact particle data:
35  //0 is time
36  //1 is length
37  //2 is x component of position
38  //3 is y component of position
39  //4 is z component of position
40  //5 is x component of momentum
41  //6 is y component of momentum
42  //7 is z component of momentum
43 
44  //compute the time step data
45  double tInitialTime = anInitialParticle.GetTime();
46  double tFinalTime = aFinalParticle.GetTime();
47  double tDeltaTime = tFinalTime - tInitialTime;
48  double tFraction = aTimeStep / tDeltaTime;
49  double tInterpolatedTime = tInitialTime + aTimeStep;
50 
51  //time step must be within the range specified by the last step
52  if( tFraction >= 0.0 && tFraction <= 1.0)
53  {
54  //compute the cubic hermite polynomials
55  double h30, h31, h32, h33;
56  CubicHermite(tFraction, h30, h31, h32, h33);
57 
58  //retrieve the first derivative evaluation from the integrator
59  KSTrajExactDerivative initialDerivative;
60  initialDerivative = 0.0;;
61  bool isValid = anIntegrator.GetInitialDerivative(initialDerivative );
62  if(!isValid)
63  {
64  aDifferentiator.Differentiate(anInitialParticle.GetTime(), anInitialParticle, initialDerivative);
65  }
66 
67  //retrieve the final derivative evaluation from the integrator
68  KSTrajExactDerivative finalDerivative;
69  finalDerivative = 0.0;
70  isValid = anIntegrator.GetFinalDerivative(finalDerivative );
71  if(!isValid)
72  {
73  aDifferentiator.Differentiate(aFinalParticle.GetTime(), aFinalParticle, finalDerivative);
74  }
75 
76  //compute the cubic interpolation for all variables in the particle array
77  anIntermediateParticle = h30*anInitialParticle + h31*tDeltaTime*initialDerivative + h32*tDeltaTime*finalDerivative + h33*aFinalParticle;
78  anIntermediateParticle[0] = tInterpolatedTime; //explicitly set the time variable
79 
80  return;
81  }
82  else
83  {
84  //outside of step range, use linear interpolator to extrapolate
85  trajmsg_debug( "time step out of range defaulting to linear interpolator." << eom );
86 
87  fFastInterpolator.Interpolate(aTime, anIntegrator, aDifferentiator, anInitialParticle, aFinalParticle, aTimeStep, anIntermediateParticle);
88  }
89  }
90 
91  void KSTrajInterpolatorHermite::Interpolate(double aTime,
92  const KSTrajExactSpinIntegrator& anIntegrator,
93  const KSTrajExactSpinDifferentiator& aDifferentiator,
94  const KSTrajExactSpinParticle& anInitialParticle,
95  const KSTrajExactSpinParticle& aFinalParticle,
96  const double& aTimeStep,
97  KSTrajExactSpinParticle& anIntermediateParticle ) const
98  {
99  //cubic interpolation on all variables, except postion, which is quintic
100 
101  //exactspin particle data:
102  //0 is time
103  //1 is length
104  //2 is x component of position
105  //3 is y component of position
106  //4 is z component of position
107  //5 is x component of momentum
108  //6 is y component of momentum
109  //7 is z component of momentum
110  //8 is 0 component of spin
111  //9 is x component of spin
112  //10 is y component of spin
113  //11 is z component of spin
114 
115  //compute the time step data
116  double tInitialTime = anInitialParticle.GetTime();
117  double tFinalTime = aFinalParticle.GetTime();
118  double tDeltaTime = tFinalTime - tInitialTime;
119  double tFraction = aTimeStep / tDeltaTime;
120  double tInterpolatedTime = tInitialTime + aTimeStep;
121 
122  //time step
123  if( tFraction >= 0.0 && tFraction <= 1.0)
124  {
125  //compute the cubic hermite polynomials
126  double h30, h31, h32, h33;
127  CubicHermite(tFraction, h30, h31, h32, h33);
128 
129  //retrieve the first derivative evaluation from the integrator
130  KSTrajExactSpinDerivative initialDerivative;
131  initialDerivative = 0.0;;
132  bool isValid = anIntegrator.GetInitialDerivative(initialDerivative );
133  if(!isValid)
134  {
135  aDifferentiator.Differentiate(anInitialParticle.GetTime(), anInitialParticle, initialDerivative);
136  }
137 
138  //retrieve the final derivative evaluation from the integrator
139  KSTrajExactSpinDerivative finalDerivative;
140  finalDerivative = 0.0;
141  isValid = anIntegrator.GetFinalDerivative(finalDerivative );
142  if(!isValid)
143  {
144  aDifferentiator.Differentiate(aFinalParticle.GetTime(), aFinalParticle, finalDerivative);
145  }
146 
147  //compute the cubic interpolation for all variables in the particle array
148  anIntermediateParticle = h30*anInitialParticle + h31*tDeltaTime*initialDerivative + h32*tDeltaTime*finalDerivative + h33*aFinalParticle;
149  anIntermediateParticle[0] = tInterpolatedTime; //explicitly set the time variable
150 
151  return;
152  }
153  else
154  {
155  //outside of step range, use linear interpolator to extrapolate
156  trajmsg_debug( "time step out of range defaulting to linear interpolator." << eom );
157 
158  fFastInterpolator.Interpolate(aTime, anIntegrator, aDifferentiator, anInitialParticle, aFinalParticle, aTimeStep, anIntermediateParticle);
159  }
160  }

162  void KSTrajInterpolatorHermite::Interpolate(double aTime,
163  const KSTrajAdiabaticSpinIntegrator& anIntegrator,
164  const KSTrajAdiabaticSpinDifferentiator& aDifferentiator,
165  const KSTrajAdiabaticSpinParticle& anInitialParticle,
166  const KSTrajAdiabaticSpinParticle& aFinalParticle,
167  const double& aTimeStep,
168  KSTrajAdiabaticSpinParticle& anIntermediateParticle ) const
169  {
170  //cubic interpolation on all variables, except postion, which is quintic
171 
172  //Adiabaticspin particle data:
173  //0 is time
174  //1 is length
175  //2 is x component of position
176  //3 is y component of position
177  //4 is z component of position
178  //5 is x component of momentum
179  //6 is y component of momentum
180  //7 is z component of momentum
181  //8 is B-aligned component of spin
182  //9 is B-perp angle of spin
183 
184  //compute the time step data
185  double tInitialTime = anInitialParticle.GetTime();
186  double tFinalTime = aFinalParticle.GetTime();
187  double tDeltaTime = tFinalTime - tInitialTime;
188  double tFraction = aTimeStep / tDeltaTime;
189  double tInterpolatedTime = tInitialTime + aTimeStep;
190 
191  //time step
192  if( tFraction >= 0.0 && tFraction <= 1.0)
193  {
194  //compute the cubic hermite polynomials
195  double h30, h31, h32, h33;
196  CubicHermite(tFraction, h30, h31, h32, h33);
197 
198  //retrieve the first derivative evaluation from the integrator
199  KSTrajAdiabaticSpinDerivative initialDerivative;
200  initialDerivative = 0.0;;
201  bool isValid = anIntegrator.GetInitialDerivative(initialDerivative );
202  if(!isValid)
203  {
204  aDifferentiator.Differentiate(anInitialParticle.GetTime(), anInitialParticle, initialDerivative);
205  }
206 
207  //retrieve the final derivative evaluation from the integrator
208  KSTrajAdiabaticSpinDerivative finalDerivative;
209  finalDerivative = 0.0;
210  isValid = anIntegrator.GetFinalDerivative(finalDerivative );
211  if(!isValid)
212  {
213  aDifferentiator.Differentiate(aFinalParticle.GetTime(), aFinalParticle, finalDerivative);
214  }
215 
216  //compute the cubic interpolation for all variables in the particle array
217  anIntermediateParticle = h30*anInitialParticle + h31*tDeltaTime*initialDerivative + h32*tDeltaTime*finalDerivative + h33*aFinalParticle;
218  anIntermediateParticle[0] = tInterpolatedTime; //explicitly set the time variable
219 
220  return;
221  }
222  else
223  {
224  //outside of step range, use linear interpolator to extrapolate
225  trajmsg_debug( "time step out of range defaulting to linear interpolator." << eom );
226 
227  fFastInterpolator.Interpolate(aTime, anIntegrator, aDifferentiator, anInitialParticle, aFinalParticle, aTimeStep, anIntermediateParticle);
228  }
229  }
230 
231  void KSTrajInterpolatorHermite::Interpolate(double aTime,
232  const KSTrajAdiabaticIntegrator& anIntegrator,
233  const KSTrajAdiabaticDifferentiator& aDifferentiator,
234  const KSTrajAdiabaticParticle& anInitialParticle,
235  const KSTrajAdiabaticParticle& aFinalParticle,
236  const double& aTimeStep,
237  KSTrajAdiabaticParticle& anIntermediateParticle ) const
238  {
239  //we only do cubic interpolation on the adiabatic particle
240 
241  //adiabatic particle data:
242  //0 is time
243  //1 is length
244  //2 is x component of guiding center
245  //3 is y component of guiding center
246  //4 is z component of guiding center
247  //5 is longitudinal momentum
248  //6 is transverse momentum
249  //7 is phase
250 
251  //compute the time step data
252  double tInitialTime = anInitialParticle.GetTime();
253  double tFinalTime = aFinalParticle.GetTime();
254  double tDeltaTime = tFinalTime - tInitialTime;
255  double tFraction = aTimeStep / (tFinalTime - tInitialTime);
256  double tInterpolatedTime = tInitialTime + aTimeStep;
257 
258  if( tFraction >= 0.0 && tFraction <= 1.0)
259  {
260  if( tFraction < 1e-13 )
261  {
262  anIntermediateParticle = anInitialParticle;
263  }
264  else if( std::fabs(1.0 - tFraction) < 1e-13)
265  {
266  anIntermediateParticle = aFinalParticle;
267  }
268  else
269  {
270  //compute the cubic hermite polynomials
271  double h30, h31, h32, h33;
272  CubicHermite(tFraction, h30, h31, h32, h33);
273 
274  //retrieve the first derivative evaluation from the integrator
275  KSTrajAdiabaticDerivative initialDerivative;
276  initialDerivative = 0.0;
277  bool isValid = anIntegrator.GetInitialDerivative(initialDerivative);
278  if(!isValid)
279  {
280  aDifferentiator.Differentiate(anInitialParticle.GetTime(), anInitialParticle, initialDerivative);
281  }
282 
283  //retrieve the final derivative evaluation from the integrator
284  KSTrajAdiabaticDerivative finalDerivative;
285  finalDerivative = 0.0;
286  isValid = anIntegrator.GetFinalDerivative(finalDerivative);
287  if(!isValid)
288  {
289  aDifferentiator.Differentiate(aFinalParticle.GetTime(), aFinalParticle, finalDerivative);
290  }
291 
292  //compute the cubic interpolation for all variables in the particle array
293  anIntermediateParticle = h30*anInitialParticle + h31*tDeltaTime*initialDerivative + h32*tDeltaTime*finalDerivative + h33*aFinalParticle;
294  anIntermediateParticle[0] = tInterpolatedTime; //explicitly set the time variable
295  }
296 
297  //interpolate alpha and beta linearly
298  //(leaving this unchanged from fast interpolator, may need to improve this)
299  KThreeVector tInitialAlpha = anInitialParticle.GetAlpha().Unit();
300  KThreeVector tFinalAlpha = aFinalParticle.GetAlpha().Unit();
301  KThreeVector tRotationVectorAlpha = tInitialAlpha.Cross( tFinalAlpha );
302  double tRotationAngleAlpha = tFraction * asin( tRotationVectorAlpha.Magnitude() );
303  KThreeVector tRotationAxisAlpha = tRotationVectorAlpha.Unit();
304  KThreeVector tInterpolatedAlpha = cos( tRotationAngleAlpha ) * tInitialAlpha + sin( tRotationAngleAlpha ) * tRotationAxisAlpha.Cross( tInitialAlpha );
305 
306  KThreeVector tInitialBeta = anInitialParticle.GetBeta().Unit();
307  KThreeVector tFinalBeta = aFinalParticle.GetBeta().Unit();
308  KThreeVector tRotationVectorBeta = tInitialBeta.Cross( tFinalBeta );
309  double tRotationAngleBeta = tFraction * asin( tRotationVectorBeta.Magnitude() );
310  KThreeVector tRotationAxisBeta = tRotationVectorBeta.Unit();
311  KThreeVector tInterpolatedBeta = cos( tRotationAngleBeta ) * tInitialBeta + sin( tRotationAngleBeta ) * tRotationAxisBeta.Cross( tInitialBeta );
312 
313  anIntermediateParticle.SetAlpha( tInterpolatedAlpha );
314  anIntermediateParticle.SetBeta( tInterpolatedBeta );
315  }
316  else
317  {
318  //outside of step range, use linear interpolator to extrapolate
319  trajmsg_debug( "time step out of range defaulting to linear interpolator." << eom );
320 
321  fFastInterpolator.Interpolate(aTime, anIntegrator, aDifferentiator, anInitialParticle, aFinalParticle, aTimeStep, anIntermediateParticle);
322  }
323  }
324 
325  void KSTrajInterpolatorHermite::Interpolate(double aTime,
326  const KSTrajMagneticIntegrator& anIntegrator,
327  const KSTrajMagneticDifferentiator& aDifferentiator,
328  const KSTrajMagneticParticle& anInitialParticle,
329  const KSTrajMagneticParticle& aFinalParticle,
330  const double& aTimeStep,
331  KSTrajMagneticParticle& anIntermediateParticle ) const
332  {
333  //only do cubic interpolation for the magnetic particle
334 
335  //compute the time step data
336  double tInitialTime = anInitialParticle.GetTime();
337  double tFinalTime = aFinalParticle.GetTime();
338  double tDeltaTime = tFinalTime - tInitialTime;
339  double tFraction = aTimeStep / (tFinalTime - tInitialTime);
340  double tInterpolatedTime = tInitialTime + aTimeStep;
341 
342  if( tFraction >= 0.0 && tFraction <= 1.0)
343  {
344  //compute the cubic hermite polynomials
345  double h30, h31, h32, h33;
346  CubicHermite(tFraction, h30, h31, h32, h33);
347 
348  //retrieve the first derivative evaluation from the integrator
349  KSTrajMagneticDerivative initialDerivative;
350  initialDerivative = 0.0;
351  bool isValid = anIntegrator.GetInitialDerivative(initialDerivative);
352  if(!isValid)
353  {
354  aDifferentiator.Differentiate(anInitialParticle.GetTime(), anInitialParticle, initialDerivative);
355  }
356 
357  //retrieve the final derivative evaluation from the integrator
358  KSTrajMagneticDerivative finalDerivative;
359  finalDerivative = 0.0;
360  isValid = anIntegrator.GetFinalDerivative(finalDerivative);
361  if(!isValid)
362  {
363  aDifferentiator.Differentiate(aFinalParticle.GetTime(), aFinalParticle, finalDerivative);
364  }
365 
366  //compute the cubic interpolation for all variables in the particle array
367  anIntermediateParticle = h30*anInitialParticle + h31*tDeltaTime*initialDerivative + h32*tDeltaTime*finalDerivative + h33*aFinalParticle;
368  anIntermediateParticle[0] = tInterpolatedTime; //explicitly set the time variable
369  }
370  else
371  {
372  //outside of step range, use linear interpolator to extrapolate
373  trajmsg_debug( "time step out of range defaulting to linear interpolator." << eom );
374 
375  fFastInterpolator.Interpolate(aTime, anIntegrator, aDifferentiator, anInitialParticle, aFinalParticle, aTimeStep, anIntermediateParticle);
376  }
377  }

380  void KSTrajInterpolatorHermite::Interpolate(double aTime,
381  const KSTrajElectricIntegrator& anIntegrator,
382  const KSTrajElectricDifferentiator& aDifferentiator,
383  const KSTrajElectricParticle& anInitialParticle,
384  const KSTrajElectricParticle& aFinalParticle,
385  const double& aTimeStep,
386  KSTrajElectricParticle& anIntermediateParticle ) const
387  {
388  //only do cubic interpolation for the magnetic particle
389 
390  //compute the time step data
391  double tInitialTime = anInitialParticle.GetTime();
392  double tFinalTime = aFinalParticle.GetTime();
393  double tDeltaTime = tFinalTime - tInitialTime;
394  double tFraction = aTimeStep / (tFinalTime - tInitialTime);
395  double tInterpolatedTime = tInitialTime + aTimeStep;
396 
397  if( tFraction >= 0.0 && tFraction <= 1.0)
398  {
399  //compute the cubic hermite polynomials
400  double h30, h31, h32, h33;
401  CubicHermite(tFraction, h30, h31, h32, h33);
402 
403  //retrieve the first derivative evaluation from the integrator
404  KSTrajElectricDerivative initialDerivative;
405  initialDerivative = 0.0;
406  bool isValid = anIntegrator.GetInitialDerivative(initialDerivative);
407  if(!isValid)
408  {
409  aDifferentiator.Differentiate(anInitialParticle.GetTime(), anInitialParticle, initialDerivative);
410  }
411 
412  //retrieve the final derivative evaluation from the integrator
413  KSTrajElectricDerivative finalDerivative;
414  finalDerivative = 0.0;
415  isValid = anIntegrator.GetFinalDerivative(finalDerivative);
416  if(!isValid)
417  {
418  aDifferentiator.Differentiate(aFinalParticle.GetTime(), aFinalParticle, finalDerivative);
419  }
420 
421  //compute the cubic interpolation for all variables in the particle array
422  anIntermediateParticle = h30*anInitialParticle + h31*tDeltaTime*initialDerivative + h32*tDeltaTime*finalDerivative + h33*aFinalParticle;
423  anIntermediateParticle[0] = tInterpolatedTime; //explicitly set the time variable
424  }
425  else
426  {

435  double
436  KSTrajInterpolatorHermite::DistanceMetric(const KSTrajExactParticle& valueA, const KSTrajExactParticle& valueB) const
437  {
438  KThreeVector a = valueA.GetPosition();
439  KThreeVector b = valueB.GetPosition();
440  return (a-b).Magnitude();
441  }

482 
483  //evaluate cubic hermite basis functions on [0,1]
484  void
485  KSTrajInterpolatorHermite::CubicHermite(double t, double& h30, double& h31, double& h32, double& h33)
486  {
487  double t2 = t*t;
488  double t3 = t*t2;
489  h30 = 1.0 - 3.0*t2 + 2.0*t3;
490  h31 = t - 2.0*t2 + t3;
491  h32 = t3 - t2;
492  h33 = 3.0*t2 - 2.0*t3;
493  }
494 
495  //evaluate quintic hermite basis functions on [0,1]
496  void
497  KSTrajInterpolatorHermite::QuinticHermite(double t, double& h50, double& h51, double& h52, double& h53, double& h54, double& h55)
498  {
499  double t2 = t*t;
500  double t3 = t*t2;
501  double t4 = t*t3;
502  double t5 = t*t4;
503 
504  h50 = 1 - 10.0*t3 + 15.0*t4 - 6.0*t5;
505  h51 = t - 6.0*t3 + 8.0*t4 - 3.0*t5;
506  h52 = 0.5*t2 - 1.5*t3 + 1.5*t4 - 0.5*t5;
507  h53 = 0.5*t3 - t4 + 0.5*t5;
508  h54 = -4.0*t3 + 7.0*t4 - 3.0*t5;
509  h55 = 10.0*t3 - 15.0*t4 + 6.0*t5;
510  }
511 
512 
513 }
